articles.title: Nepal Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli resigns amid continuing anti-corruption protests
articles.description: Nepal's Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday amid ongoing anti-corruption protests that have turned violent. The protests, initially sparked by a social media ban, have broadened into a wider campaign against government corruption and apathy. The Nepal Army has taken charge of security in the capital, Kathmandu, following the deaths of at least 30 people during the demonstrations.

articles.title: Israel launches air strikes targeting Hamas leaders in Qatar
articles.description: Israel has conducted air strikes in Qatar targeting Hamas leaders, escalating tensions in the region. The strikes occurred amid ongoing discussions for a Gaza ceasefire. Qatar has condemned the attack, stating it was warned by the US only 10 minutes after the strike, and accused Israel of sabotaging peace talks. Hamas claims its top leaders survived, but some lower-ranking members were killed.

articles.title: US economy added 911,000 fewer jobs than previously believed
articles.description: A revised jobs report indicates that the U.S. economy added 911,000 fewer jobs over a 12-month period than previously estimated. This significant downward revision has raised concerns among financial leaders about the overall health of the economy.
